Package io.curiositycore.thecuriositycore.database.mysql.queries

Class SqlQueries

java.lang.Object
io.curiositycore.thecuriositycore.database.mysql.queries.SqlQueries
public class SqlQueries extends Object
Utility class responsible for querying a SQL datasource for the purposes of creating, manipulating or retrieving table data.

    SqlQueries()

  • Constructor Details

    • SqlQueries

      private SqlQueries()
      Private constructor to avoid attempted construction of this utility class.

  • Method Details

    • createNewTable

      public static void createNewTable(String tableName, DataSource dataSource)
      Creates a new table within the Sql database. The table has no columns other than id.
      Parameters:
      tableName - What to name the newly created table.
      dataSource - The datasource where the table is to be created.

    • addColumnToTable

      public static void addColumnToTable(String tableName, String columnName, DataSource dataSource, String dataTypeString)
      Adds a column to the table. The column has a user defined datatype.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to add the column to.
      columnName - The name of the column to create.
      dataSource - The datasource where the table is located.
      dataTypeString - The string that represents the datasource.

    • updateRow

      public static void updateRow(String tableName, DataSource dataSource, SqlRow rowToUpdate, String[] columnNames)
      Updates the row of an SQL table. Creates a statement with enough "?" placeholders to accommodate the number of columns in the table.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to update the row of.
      dataSource - The datasource where the table is located.
      rowToUpdate - The SqlRow to update.
      columnNames - The name of the columns.

    • deleteRow

      public static void deleteRow(String tableName, DataSource dataSource, int indexOfRowToDelete)
      Deletes a row within the SQL database table, based on the index id of the row.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to delete the row from.
      dataSource - The datasource where the table is located.
      indexOfRowToDelete - The index id of the row to delete.

    • resetIds

      public static void resetIds(String tableName, DataSource dataSource)
      Resets the id indexes of the database to 1. This is doen when all id's within a table have been deleted.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to reset the ids for.
      dataSource - The data source where the table is located.

    • insertValuesIntoTable

      public static void insertValuesIntoTable(String tableName, DataSource dataSource, String[] valueIds, Object[] values)
      Inserts a row of values into an existing table.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to add the row of values to.
      dataSource - The data source where the table is located.
      valueIds - The names of each of columns.
      values - The values of the row to add.

    • tableExistsInDatabase

      public static boolean tableExistsInDatabase(String tableName, DataSource dataSource)
      Checks to see if the table exists within the SQL database.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to check.
      dataSource - The data source to check.
      Returns:
      True if the table exists within the database, false if it does not.

    • getRowData

      public static List<SqlRow> getRowData(String tableName, DataSource dataSource) throws SQLException
      Gets all the rows within the specified table.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table.
      dataSource - The data source where the table is located.
      Returns:
      The rows of the table.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • retrieveSqlDataWithoutParams

      public static List<Object[]> retrieveSqlDataWithoutParams(String statement, DataSource dataSource) throws SQLException
      Retreives SQL data from a table without any parameters.
      Parameters:
      statement - The statement to query the database with.
      dataSource - The datasource of the table to retrieve data from.
      Returns:
      The data to retrieve as a List of object arrays.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Exception that will occur if the query is not succesful.

    • executeWithoutParams

      private static void executeWithoutParams(String statement, DataSource dataSource)
      Execution of an SQL query with no parameters.
      Parameters:
      statement - The statement to query, as a string.
      dataSource - The datasource where the query is to be executed.

    • executeWithParams

      private static void executeWithParams(String statement, DataSource dataSource, Object[] values)
      Execution of an SQL query with parameters.
      Parameters:
      statement - The statement to query, as a string.
      dataSource - The datasource where the query is to be executed.
      values - The values of the query's parameters.

    • equalIdAndValueLengths

      private static boolean equalIdAndValueLengths(String[] valueIds, Object[] values)
      Checks to see if the value ids (i.e. column names) are of the same length as the objects to be added to a table.
      Parameters:
      valueIds - The ids of the column's in the table.
      values - The values of the row being added to a table.
      Returns:
      True if the 2 arrays are of equal length, false if they are not.
